segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like he’s on a mission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s balancing on his tiptoes, and his sister is just waiting for a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re going to get in so much trouble if that woman turns around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and they’re still focused on snacks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t tell if they don’t care or just don’t see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so calm, like she’s done this a hundred times before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they even know how close they are to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing feels like a cartoon, but it’s happening right in front of me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they grab those cookies fast and get out of there before the stool goes down.
segments.speaker: PAR
